meanings.definition: To preserve or season with salt in grains or kernels.
meanings.sent1: I am corning the meat for our barbecue by sprinkling salt on it.
meanings.sent2: She likes corning her vegetables with a little bit of salt before roasting them.
meanings.sent3: The chef was corning the chicken so enthusiastically that he accidentally spilled salt everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The idea of corning the fish with salt before grilling it seemed strange at first, but it turned out delicious.
meanings.sent5: Corning the pork chops with just the right amount of salt made them incredibly flavorful.

meanings.definition: To form into grains or kernels.
meanings.sent1: The baker is corning the dough to create a textured crust on the bread.
meanings.sent2: After corning the mixture, it will be ready to be shaped into small balls.
meanings.sent3: The children were corning the playdough into tiny shapes for their art project.
meanings.sent4: The farmer was corning the seeds carefully to ensure even distribution in the soil.
meanings.sent5: Corning the sugar before adding it to the recipe helps prevent clumping.

meanings.definition: To shape or cut with a sharp instrument.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor is corning the marble to create intricate details in the statue.
meanings.sent2: Corning the paper with precision, she carefully crafted a beautiful origami swan.
meanings.sent3: He was corning the cardboard to make a DIY organizer for his desk.
meanings.sent4: The chef was corning the vegetables into decorative shapes for the salad.
meanings.sent5: Corning the fabric before sewing helps achieve clean and neat edges.
